逼.definition: to force (sb to do sth); to compel; to press for; to extort; to press on towards; to press up to; to close in on; euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

逼上梁山.definition: driven to join the Liangshan Mountain rebels; to drive to revolt; to force sb to desperate action

逼人太甚.definition: to push sb too far; to go too far (in oppressing people)

逼供信.definition: to obtain confessions by compulsion; confession under duress

逼債.definition: to press for payment of debts; to dun

逼和.definition: to force a draw (in chess, competition etc)

逼問.definition: to question intensely; to interrogate; to demand information

逼宮.definition: to force the king or emperor to abdicate

逼真.definition: lifelike; true to life; distinctly; clearly

逼肖.definition: to bear a close resemblance to; to be the very image of

逼良為娼.definition: to force an honest girl into prostitution (idiom); to debauch

逼視.definition: to look at from close up; to watch intently

逼近.definition: to press on towards; to close in on; to approach; to draw near

逼迫.definition: to force; to compel; to coerce

逼逼.definition: (vulgar) to rattle on; to talk drivel
